'Peter Reading' (27 July 1946 â 17 November 2011 ) was an English poet
and the author of 26 collections of poetry. He is known for his choice of ugly
subject matter, and use of classical metres. Keith Tuma, Anthology of Twentieth-
Century British and Irish Poetry (2001), p. 725. The Oxford Companion to
Twentieth-Century Poetry describes his verse as "strongly anti-romantic,
disenchanted and usually satirical". Martin Seymour-Smith "Reading, Peter"
in Ian Hamilton (ed.) The Oxford Companion to Twentieth-Century Poetry, Oxford:
Oxford University Press, 1994, p.443 Interviewed by Robert Potts, he
described his work as a combination of "painstaking care" and
"misanthropy". Robert Potts
[http://www.oxfordpoetry.co.uk/texts.php?int=v3_peterreading "An Interview with
Peter Reading", Oxford Poetry, OP V.3 [Winter 1990]
